Stele Inscription for the Late Abbot Qin of Zisheng Chan Temple in Xuzhou, Jiaxu Renyin Mid-Autumn.
People from Xuzhou brought the remains of the late Great Master Qin to be enshrined in a stupa on Anle Mountain in Yuhang.
This began.
His Dharma heir, Shengwen Ru, a person from An,
Commanded Qi Song to write and inscribe it.
The abbot's name was Sheng Qin, and he was originally surnamed Xie.
He did not write the details of how he obtained the surname.
He followed the Buddhist teachings.
He was a person from Shouyang in Xiangzhou.
He left home as a young man.
He served Bai Rongshan Weiqi Chan Master in the north.
During the Xiangfu period, he was tested for reciting sutras.
He was then allowed to shave his head.
That year, he received full ordination at Yanling Temple in Guiling.
He returned and told Rong Hui that his teacher had just passed away.
After the funeral, he set out westward in a leisurely manner.
He further sought out those who were his teacher's disciples.
The teacher's nature was pure, deep, noble, and sincere.
He had a sense of the Way since childhood.
When he was young, he had his own insights.
He studied extensively with the old Chan masters in Hengzhou, Xiangyang, and Yingzhou.
But he alone fully grasped the profound meaning of Chan from Chan Master Deshan Xuanjian.
At first, he asked Chan Master Xuanjian to resolve the phrases of Yunmen.
Although he diligently asked questions for three months,
Xuanjian never gave him any explanation.
He wanted him to have his own realization.ğŸ”½One day, after he had awakened, he went to Xuanjian to present his understanding.
Xuanjian, upon seeing him, said,
You have already penetrated.
At that moment, the teacher suddenly felt his body transcend the void.
He did not feel the house or hut as obstructions.
He returned to where he was standing.
All over his body, sweat poured down.
The spiritual manifestation of his realization of the Way was like this.
Before this, the teacher had served as a monk under another teacher.
He studied the method of mindfulness of breathing.
At first, he was taught the method.
Then, he sat on a mat and lit a candle in front of his teacher.
Suddenly, there was a strange light that shot up.
Round and bright like the sun.
The light went out, but the candle wick was not damaged at all.
His teacher said,
You are a supreme vehicle dharma vessel.
Strive for it, do not extinguish yourself with this.
His spiritual resonance was also like this.
Later, those who studied Chan.
Then, they greatly admired it.
Came to the West of Zhejiang and mixed with the traces on Anle Mountain in Yuhang.
In the beginning of the Huangyou era, the prefect of Jiaxing, Lord Nie.
Generously loaded and heard his reputation.
Led the people of the prefecture to order him to lead his disciples here.
After twelve years, the people of Xiu, whether wise or foolish, male or female, were greatly transformed by his virtuous conduct.
The number of Dharma companions who flocked to his assembly did not decrease by the day.
The hermitage was completely repaired and the monastic supplies were fully prepared.
And Xiu had the Chan abode, which was started by Chan Master Xing.
In the fifth year of the Jiaxu era, on the Renyin day of the middle summer, he showed slight illness.
He sat upright, spoke a verse, and passed away.
He was 68 years old in the world.
He was 42 years old as a monk.
On the Jiyou day of the fifth month in the Jiaxu year,
He followed the teachings and cremated him.
He obtained five-colored Å›arÄ«ra.

The disciples who were ordained succeeded to his Dharma and led the assembly in one direction.
It is said that Wen.

He named the book The Collection of the Original Teachings.
And his disciples are transmitting it.
However, the Dharma he attained.
It is truly the secret essentials of all Buddhas.
It is what all sentient beings rely on.
It is what all patriarchs transmit.ğŸ”½It cannot be reached through speech or silence.

Therefore, although the Venerable was diligent in teaching and guiding the assembly and interacting with people,
And his words always simplified the conditions of the opportunity, not being verbose or greatly extensive.
The essential path of his compassion and virtue entered people most deeply.
Therefore, when he passed away,
The people of Xuzhou, with the city overturned, wailed and grieved.

You gentlemen, with Qisong, have a Daoist friendship with the Chan master, and know each other even more deeply and in detail.

Record of the Memorial Tower of the Late Chan Master Xianshou of Zisheng Chan Temple in Xuzhou. The Chan master was ill.
I went from Hangzhou to ask about medicine and treatment.
He often looked at me and said:

Record my Dharma heirs.

He was originally from Jianyang.
His surname was Fan.
The Fan family had been a scholarly clan for generations.
His father and grandfather both served in office.
They no longer wrote.
At first, the Chan master was born in Kuaiji due to his father's official duties.
When his father died in office in Haiyan County,
he lived in Xiu with his mother, managing the family property.
By this time, the Chan master was only five years old.
But his outstanding spirit was already evident.
His mother found it extraordinary.
She ordered him to become a novice under the disciple Zhao of Jingxing and join the Zisheng Temple.
By the age of ten, he had his head shaved.ğŸ”½He received full ordination at Lingguang Temple.
He studied the Surangama Sutra and the Sutra of Perfect Enlightenment under lecturers.
He lived in seclusion for ten years.
At the age of twenty, he extensively traveled outside and visited various Chan masters.
At the age of thirty, he returned.
At first, Xiu County did not have a Chan residence.
Those who came were also lacking something.
However, when the Chan master returned,
he changed the temple.
He diligently lived with the assembly and instructed his followers.
It was like the Chan rules of the ten directions, the main temple.
After a little repair, he built a hut and lived alone in the garden.
He earnestly practiced the ascetic practices.
He did not go out or sleep for nineteen years.
Although he wore poor clothes and ate poor food,
he regarded it as peaceful.
Before long,
the former Xuefeng Qing Chan Master came to his hut and said,
Good! You have reached this level.
He then fully demonstrated the Dharma he had realized,
and Chan Master Qing greatly approved of it.
In the end, he also succeeded Chan Master Qing.
By the Tiansheng era,
the prefect of the prefecture, Zhang Gong Ji Sheng, highly regarded him.
He then ordered the Chan practitioners to carry out the practice.
Later, Ye Gong Daqing, the former Academician of the Hanlin Academy, took up the post of prefect.
Upon seeing this, he was even more delighted.
He finally revered him as an elder.
He ordered him to transmit the Dharma.
For nearly twenty years, he finally passed away with this object.
Alas!
His worldly age was already seventy-six.
And his years as a monk were sixty-two.
The Chan master governed this temple.
From his prime to his old age, it had been forty-six years.
He was very strict with people and had already reached a state of simplicity.
His food and clothing were necessarily plain and frugal.
He did not agree with the customs of the times.
Therefore, his disciples considered him difficult and had few close attachments.
Only the literati and officials respected his purity and simplicity.
They could not bear to mix alcohol and meat in his room.
In the past, the monks in Wu Prefecture lost the proper order in sitting meditation.
They would arbitrarily use their power to rank high and low.
They no longer discussed it in terms of precepts and virtue.
The Chan master sighed and often wrote to the officials to seek justice.
Although the world people all did not pay attention to his words, the Chan master never gave up on himself.
When Ye Gong Daqing became the transport commissioner of Wuyue,
the Chan master again sent him a letter.
Ye Gong accepted it.
He then corrected the matter in his jurisdiction.
Afterwards, the monks of Mount Tiantai indeed recommended the Chan master to the high seat.
As soon as the second assembly was held, he declined.
He did not enter the secular world for nearly fifteen years.
However, he was also naturally upright and concerned about protecting the Dharma.
In the past, he once spoke with me, saying:
I am unable to greatly benefit beings with the Dharma.
My virtue and practice are also not worth observing.
I am ashamed before the sages of the past.
If I were to bear witness to the chaos in the Dharma, it would be even more shameful.
I immediately responded to him, saying:
You need not be humble.
The Caoxi Chan school is the wonderful way of the world.
Yet few learners reach it.
The twelve dhÅ«tas are the utmost practice of leaving the world.
It is difficult for our disciples.
He was able to uphold the Dharma and not care for his own body.
This is also what is difficult for people to do.
These three masters all attained and practiced it.
What is there to be ashamed of?
The master said:
How dare I do this?
Nevertheless, I use this to praise him among us people.
It is to encourage others.ğŸ”½When the Chan master passed away,
It has been five years since the jiaxu year of the Huangyou era.
Alas!
The Stele Inscription for the Pagoda of the Late Master Puzhao of Lingyin, and the Preface The Dharma name of the late Master Puzhao of Lingyin was Youmin.
He was a person from Yushan in Xinyang.
His original surname was Ye.
When he was a child, he had the aspiration to leave the household life.
He informed his parents and obtained their permission.
He then entered the monastery of Xingjiao in his prefecture.
He became a novice monk under the guidance of Master Sengquan.
After receiving full ordination, he traveled to various places to seek the Way.
He came to Huilin and met Chan Master Huiming.
He had the potential to attain the Way.
He immediately accepted [the teachings] and took on the role of a disciple.
He studied all the Dharma methods.
There are no easy or difficult tasks in the Dharma.
He has experienced them all.
After a long time, Huiming ordered the master to oversee the affairs of the temple.
Before long, a great fire destroyed the temple.
He was just recovering from the loss.
Those who worked with him were in danger and all worried about the disaster.
The master said to them,
I am in charge of the affairs of the temple.
The blame is entirely on me.
I alone will bear it.
You need not be afraid.
The officials indeed did not enter the temple to question the master.
The younger brother was only sitting by the stove.
How could this be what the ancients called not trying to avoid danger?
Later, when Huiming passed away and the funeral was completed,
The master then led the assembly, saying,
The local government has invited the great elder Huizhao, the wise master, to govern the temple.
To succeed Huiming.ğŸ”½The oversight is still to be assisted by the temple supervisor.
Working together, we will restore the temple.
In less than ten years, he repaired the buildings.
It was even more magnificent than the old one, with more than a thousand rooms.
During the Qianyuan era, the court accepted his recommendation and bestowed on him ceremonial robes.
Later, he was also given the title of Puzhi.ğŸ”½After Huizhao passed away,
the master was seriously ill.
He still struggled to take care of the funeral affairs.
At first, when Huizhao was about to die, he left a letter.
Recommending the master to succeed him.
The officials doubted the matter.
They did not give him Lingyin.ğŸ”½They ordered another monk to take charge of it.
The master served the monk even more respectfully.
Without the slightest bit of contempt or stinginess in his words and appearance.
But people admired him even more for his virtue.
At that time, the prefect Longtu Ji knew about it.
He then recommended Tianzhu Monastery.
Ordering the master to live there as an elder.
When Gu Wen Sun first became the Grand Master for State Affairs in Hangzhou,
He specially promoted him to be the abbot of Lingyin.
On the day he began to preach the Dharma,
Sun, the Grand Master, was dressed in luxurious clothes and rode in a luxurious carriage.
There were no less than a hundred people.
They gathered in advance to burn incense.
Listening to what he said.
The number of monks and laypeople, old and young, noble and humble, who came to listen was in the tens of thousands.
On that day, the sounds of people and the tracks of horses filled the mountains and valleys.
Such was the grandness of the Dharma assembly.
The master's nature was broad-minded, compassionate, and forgiving.
He treated people with courtesy and tolerance.
And people also greatly admired him.
Thus, in the six years he resided in the temple,
the temple became more refined and the community more peaceful.
He ordained twenty-three disciples.
In the second winter month of the second year of the Jiayou era,
he suddenly felt slightly ill and lay down.
One day before his death,
he entrusted the temple to the current Chan Master Meng.
His speech was detailed and correct,
as if he was in his usual state, not declining.
On the thirteenth day, he got up at cock's crow, washed his face,
and asked about the time. Then he sat peacefully and passed away.
His worldly age was sixty-one.
His years as a monk were forty-one.
On the twenty-ninth day of this month, he entered the stupa inside the northern wall of the monastery in the Huayuan valley.
The stupa has already informed the master that he seeks to be inscribed with his deeds.
However, in the ancient biographies of eminent monks, it is said that only those who have virtue, words, and merit in the teaching can be recorded.
Now Lingyin is the most famous temple in the world.
It is indeed through the Buddha's Dharma that it prospers and declines.
Alas, Puzhao's lifelong achievements in this temple.
How can it not be said that he has merit in the Dharma?
I therefore do not refuse.
I will therefore record his deeds.
The inscription says:ğŸ”½Merit lies in the Dharma.
Virtue lies in the Dharma.
Since the Dharma is unborn,
Can its victorious conditions be extinguished?
The master's flourishing goodness is always so.
It is not obliterated, it does not fall.
It can certainly be seen.

Stele for the Tomb of the Late Venerable Shaode of Baosheng Temple on Shibi Mountain in Hangzhou Stele for the Tomb of the Late Venerable Shaode of Baosheng Temple on Shibi Mountain in Hangzhou Baosheng Temple on Shibi Mountain is thirty li away from Hangzhou.
It is to the west of Zulong Mountain.
It is deep in a secluded valley.
There are beautiful streams and rocks.
Although its atmosphere is pure and virtuous,
the world has never known it.
Since the Venerable Shaode and his elder brother, the Dharma Master Xingjing, lived there,
its name has become known.
It is also because the place is known because of the people.
Shaode's name was Xing Shao.
He was from Qian Tang in Hangzhou.
His original surname was Shen.
At first, his mother dreamed of receiving a strange monk's relics and swallowed them.
As a result, she became pregnant.
When he was born, his nature was pure and lovely.
He was unlike other infants.
He did not enjoy eating meat.
He loved to hear about Buddhist matters.
When he was twelve years old,
he went to Chan Master Zhijue Yanshou and asked to become his disciple. His parents followed his wish.
and obtained the precepts and thoroughly studied the Vinaya.
At that time, National Preceptor Shao was residing on Mount Tiantai.
His Way was greatly flourishing.
The Venerable then packed his robes and followed him.
The National Preceptor saw him and accepted him.
He then sent him to study the three contemplations under Dharma Master Luoxi Xiji.
He then, together with his elder brother Xing Jing, both served Dharma Master Ji and earnestly sought the great meaning.
After a short time, what he had learned was complete and he returned to Hangzhou.
He then repaired his old temple.
He also gave the temple to Dharma Master Jing to gather a lecture assembly.
Dharma Master Jing and the Venerable both left home under the guidance of Zhizhao.
The Venerable was the Dharma elder brother.
Dharma Master Jing was the secular elder brother.
Dharma Master Jing, with his original virtue, manifested himself.
Sixty years earlier,
although the famous monks of the old studies in Wu Prefecture,
they all regarded him as a great man.
At that time, he was therefore the one to whom the learners returned.
When Dharma Master Jing moved his lectures to another temple,
The Venerable then went to live at Shibi.
For fifty years before and after,
he guarded the practice of living in the mountains and forests.
He never went to villages or neighborhoods for convenience.
He lived a life of purity and simplicity.
Those who knew him praised his purity and frugality.
One day, he showed signs of a light illness.
On the evening of the third day,
he entrusted his disciples,ğŸ”½and when the tea was served to the assembly,
he sat and passed away.
At that time, he was already eighty years old.
He had been a monk for sixty-eight years.
For twenty years,
I first came to Shibi.
I met his disciple Jian Chang,
and thus heard about him.
Chang was also pure and able to uphold his predecessor's model.
He then entrusted the record of the Venerable's stupa to his fellow disciple Jian Wei,
and I often told him,
The teachings say that there are several things that are difficult for people to encounter in life,
and a good teacher is even more difficult.
The worldly books say,
I cannot see such good people anymore.
If one can see those who are always good, that would be good.
It is truly difficult to meet the wise and good.
If the master left home under Master Shou,
studied the Dharma under Master Ji,
and saw and knew under National Teacher Shao,
National Teacher Shao was an unfathomable person.
His extraordinary character and unusual virtue were widely known.
And Masters Shou and Ji were also those with the Way among our disciples.
How could the world have many such people?
If the master met and closely attended them all,
even if he only got to see them once, that would be very good.
How much more so if he obtained the Dharma through them?
Such is the master's many virtues.ğŸ”½Moreover, the brothers studied together under Master Jing,
and closely attended the Way.
They dwelled and nurtured themselves in the mountains and forests.
Their virtues throughout their lives can be recorded.
Their stupa is in the western garden of the temple.
Therefore, I write this to express it.

The Lament of the Minister of State Affairs, the Duke of Zhongshan, with a Preface The late Minister of State Affairs, the Duke of Zhongshan.
On the day of his funeral.
There were guests who were moved by his past virtue and wrote a lament.
To express their feelings.
However, the guests who originally followed Buddhism.
Externally abandoned the physical body and internally dissolved emotional falsehoods.
They should not have been moved and lamented.
It was because they could not bear to see the passing of a virtuous person and the further decline of the way of the gentleman.
They sighed in lament without end.
They provisionally entrusted their lament in words.
Nevertheless, the Duke's merits and virtues were known to the people.
His name and traces were recorded by the Grand Historian.
But those people may not have fully known the ultimate basis of the Duke's morality and virtue.
What the Duke based himself on was sincerity.
Therefore, in the beginning.
He cultivated himself and served his parents.
And the villagers imitated him.
In the middle.
He served in the court and upheld the great principles without change.
Yet the Son of Heaven appointed him.
In his old age,
he retired with dignity, setting an example for scholars and officials.
The world looked up to him.
However, in the conduct of scholars in the world,
many are sharp at the beginning but lax in the middle,
and before they are after they are mistaken.
Who is like you, advancing and retreating without the slightest fault from beginning to end?
This is because you cultivated sincerity and thickened your foundation.
You have already resigned from the canopy and dais,
and further nourish your longevity with purity.
Therefore, I am honored to be your friend,
and I have personally known the reason for your attainment of virtue and morality. It is indeed detailed and can be emulated.
Alas, your treatment of me is extraordinary.
I will not see you again.

Therefore, he did not greatly yield in literary composition and debate.

In the past, I called Fangpao Ping Shu.ğŸ”½I now look up to you, teacher, and am not worthy to compare with you.

Zhou Shu Zhi's Lament, with Preface Zhou Shu Zhi's name is Ce.

From the Six Classics, Yang and Meng,
To the histories of Sima, the teachings of Laozi and Zhuangzi, and Lie Yugong, as well as the scriptures of our Buddha,

Unique and skillful, but ashamed of rushing and competing.
In haste, he does not change his principles.
Therefore, his name is not widely known.
His friends often encouraged him because of his family's poverty and his elderly parents.
At over forty, he was finally recommended as an outstanding talent.

He devoted himself to teaching and guiding the younger generation with his Way.

I long to return to Xunyang.
I admire the style of Huiyuan and Liu Yimin.
Together with my uncle Zhi, we will grow old in the forest.
From this, I know my affairs will not be accomplished.
Alas, the path of interaction is already finished!
I mourn that I will not see him again.
Therefore, I use this to proclaim his virtue.
